column8: Jean-Philippe" name="DataCite.contributor"/><meta data-rh="true" content="SAFI Survey Results" name="DataCite.title"/><meta data-rh="true" content="dataset" name="DC.type"/><meta data-rh="true" content="figshare" name="DC.publisher"/><meta data-rh="true" content="2018/05/19" name="citation_online_date"/><meta data-rh="true" content="SAFI Survey Results" name="description"/><meta data-rh="true" content="SAFI (Studying African Farmer-Led Irrigation) is a currently running project which is looking at farming and irrigation methods. This is survey data relating to households and  agriculture in Tanzania and Mozambique. The survey data was collected through interviews conducted between November 2016 and June 2017. The survey covered such things as; household features (e.g. construction materials used
column11: assets (e.g. number and types of livestock) and details about the household members.This is a teaching version of the collected data
column12: it is not the full dataset. The survey is split into several sections:A – General questions about when and where the survey was conducted.B - Information about the household and how long they have been living in the areaC – Details about the accommodation and other buildings on the farmD – Details about the different plots of land they grow crops onE – Details about how they irrigate the land and availability of waterF – Financial details including assets owned and sources of incomeG – Details of Financial hardshipsX – Information collected directly from the smartphone (GPS) or automatically included in the form (instanceID)key_id Added to provide a unique Id for each observation. (The InstanceID field does this as well but it is not as convenient to use)A01_interview_date
column21: Number of years the household have been farming in this areaA12_agr_assoc
column22: Does the head of the household belong to an agricultural association_note2 Possible form comment relating to the sectionB_no_membrs
column23: How many members of the household?_members_count Internal count of membersB11_remittance_money
column24: Is there any financial assistance from family members not living on the farmB16_years_liv

column27: Did your spouse's parents live in this village or neighbouring village?B19_grand_liv
column28: Did your grandparents live in this village or neighbouring village?B20_sp_grand_liv

column34: Does the house have glass in at least one window?C05_buildings_in_compound

column37: How many rooms in the main house are used for sleeping?C07_other_buildings

column42: stop water leaving your fields or drain water out of any of your fields?E_no_group_count

column11:
Jean-Philippe Venot
SAFI (Studying African Farmer-Led Irrigation) is a currently running project which is looking at farming and irrigation methods. This is survey data relating to households and agriculture in Tanzania and Mozambique. The survey data was collected through interviews conducted between November 2016 and June 2017. The survey covered such things as; household features (e.g. construction materials used
column14:
assets (e.g. number and types of livestock) and details about the household members.

This is a teaching version of the collected data
column15:
it is not the full dataset.



The survey is split into several sections:
A – General questions about when and where the survey was conducted.
B - Information about the household and how long they have been living in the area
C – Details about the accommodation and other buildings on the farm
D – Details about the different plots of land they grow crops on
E – Details about how they irrigate the land and availability of water
F – Financial details including assets owned and sources of income
G – Details of Financial hardships
X – Information collected directly from the smartphone (GPS) or automatically included in the form (instanceID)

key_id Added to provide a unique Id for each observation. (The InstanceID field does this as well but it is not as convenient to use)

column939: \"offset\":0}).elements.4.virusScanInfo":{"virusFound":false}}; }());</script><script>;(function() { window.routerState = {"matchedPath":"\u002Farticles\u002F:itemType([a-zA-Z_-]+)?\u002F:url([a-zA-Z0-9_-]+)\u002F:id([0-9]+)"}; }());</script><script>;(function() { window.i18Store = {"initialI18nStore":{"en":{"common":{"membersTitle":"at fig\u003C1\u003Eshare\u003C\u002F1\u003E we have a lot of fun.\u003Cbr\u002F\u003Eshare in it with us by becoming a member of \u003C5\u003Eour team\u003C\u002F5\u003E"
column940: membersTooltip:"mouse over our team members to find out more about them"
column943: mainly focused on React and its ecosystem. Likes movies
column944: tv shows and video games. If you ever have a movie you forgot the title to or who played who in it
column945: pretty sure he can help you figure it out.\u003C\u002F0\u003E"}
column947: description:"\u003C0\u003EOur meticulous UX guru who has lead figshare`s design right from the start. Florin is a keen photographer
column950: description:"\u003C0\u003EAn early entrant to figshare and a key fixture for team morale
column951: Python enthusiast Corneliu has a love of travel
column954: description:"\u003C0\u003EChris is awesome. \u003Cbr\u002F\u003E And a luchador.\u003C\u002F0\u003E"}
column956: description:"\u003C0\u003EHis degree in Electrical Engineering and experience in transmission electron microscopy and software testing mean Alex relishes finding and fixing problems in a sciency setting. Hobbies include playing tennis - which he coached in a previous life - trying out new food joints
column959: description:"\u003C0\u003EFlorin Cantemir has a bachelor`s degree in Accounting and Management Information Systems and a master`s degree in Computer Science. He loves ancient and medieval history
column960: and is quite passionate about astronomy and all things about our universe. He spends his holidays traveling around the world.\u003C\u002F0\u003E"}
column962: description:"\u003C0\u003EAlina is our eager-to-know frontend developer who sees the world through a kind perspective and loves her job. She believes that all the problems
column964: are captivating and they have a solution
column965: you just have to want enough to find it. Even if she looks shy at first
column966: she easily manages to attract people into her sphere.\u003C\u002F0\u003E"}
column968: description:"\u003C0\u003EEmanuel has a background in computer science and likes programming languages. He is usually more comfortable in the abstract spaces than in concrete ones
column969: but somehow manages to have a human family and friends.\u003C\u002F0\u003E"}
column971: description:"\u003C0\u003EWith passion for all things python and back-end programming
column972: Teodor has servers at heart. Away from work
column973: he occupies himself with photography and literature.\u003C\u002F0\u003E"}
column975: description:"\u003C0\u003EA former sports journalist and TV presenter
column976: Adi was determined to make his passion of data mining his career. He`s found a home at figshare and enjoys building Boltzmann Machines in his spare time.\u003C\u002F0\u003E"}
column978: description:"\u003C0\u003EAs an experienced professional in libraries
column979: information management and publishing I have a keen interest in open access research and sustainability.  When not in the office you’ll either find me reading a good mystery novel
column980: watching real crime documentaries or out for a walk.\u003C\u002F0\u003E"}
column983: runs trail marathons for fun!) employee
column984: Eduard brings a degree in Computer Science and a Masters to his role in Integrations in figshare. In his spare time when he’s not traveling through the mountains
column987: and trying to get closer to Timo Boll’s table tennis skills.\u003C\u002F0\u003E"}
column989: description:"\u003C0\u003EA voracious Linux advocate with a super-computer to match his skills
column990: Daniel was the first figshare coder. A cat and family man
column991: Daniel can usually be found reading technical books for fun. He`s in the right job.\u003C\u002F0\u003E"}
column993: description:"\u003C0\u003EA teen basketball star and sports aficionado
column994: Sorin`s sometimes painful attention to detail makes him a perfect fit for figshare`s QA department. His favorite pastime these days is playing Xbox games with his 7-year old son and listening to him playing the piano.\u003C\u002F0\u003E"}
column996: description:"\u003C0\u003EWith over 10 years` experience as a Support Engineer for companies from different IT fields
column997: Radu brings a degree in Computer Science along with his passion for programming
column998: relational databases and logic to his role of Implementations Engineer at figshare. He spices up his spare time with sports
column999: video gaming and watching science fiction movies.\u003C\u002F0\u003E"}
column1001: description:"\u003C0\u003EHaving just finished her degree studies
column1002: figshare is the perfect place for Teodora to grow and learn new
column1003: exciting stuff. In her spare time
column1005: going out with her friends and travelling. She’s always looking for new challenges and meeting interesting people.\u003C\u002F0\u003E"}
column1007: description:"\u003C0\u003EMark is passionate about Open Data and Open Research and the potential this has to transform academia. He also has a crippling addiction to energy drinks.\u003C\u002F0\u003E"}
column1009: description:"\u003C0\u003EMegan has a background in publishing
column1011: and reading past her bedtime. When she`s not speaking with academics
column1012: she`s listening to School of Batman and travelling the world.\u003C\u002F0\u003E"}
column1014: description:"\u003C0\u003EWith nearly a decade of experience helping researchers and grants managers meet their research goals
column1015: Alex was perfectly poised to transition to the figshare team.  When not working
column1019: exploring a city with a good run
column1020: and far too much reality TV!\u003C\u002F0\u003E"}
column1022: description:"\u003C0\u003EAfter completing her degree in Economics and Business Information Systems
column1023: Anca discovered that her passion for writing JavaScript and esthetics is what made frontend development her career choice. Besides her professional life
column1026: travelling and being a salsa dancer.\u003C\u002F0\u003E"}
column1028: description:"\u003C0\u003EKay manages the implementation and health of Figshare repositories at institutions across the globe. A degree in documentary journalism led her to a career managing digital repositories and curating collections in both the academic and fine art sectors where she contributed to enabling open access. Outside of the office
column1029: Kay loves eating good food (but not cooking it)
column1030: spending time with her rescue dog and cats
column1031: and working towards tasting every craft beer available on planet earth.\u003C\u002F0\u003E"}
column1033: description:"\u003C0\u003EAndra loves IT. She is trying everyday to improve herself. In her freetime she loves to travel with her friends
column1034: listening to music and play games. She also loves animals.\u003C\u002F0\u003E"}
column1036: description:"\u003C0\u003EAndrew`s background in ecology and natural history collections propelled him into library school where he gravitated to data sharing and open science. In his spare time he runs
column1038: and attempts to play the harmonica.\u003C\u002F0\u003E"}
column1040: description:"\u003C0\u003EWith a degree in Computer Science
column1041: Roxana` finds Figshare a perfect place where she can learn a lot from passionate people. In the free time you have all the chances to find her buried in a book
column1045: Banshee Queen by night. A creative person with a passion for solving problems. When She’s not pushing pixels
column1046: you’ll find her on a hiking trail or trying out a new recipe.\u003C\u002F0\u003E"}
column1048: description:"\u003C0\u003EThe (way too) long-time involvement with both startups and academia made figshare the perfect place for Tudor. He codes in Python by day and dreams of having a pet pig by night.\u003C\u002F0\u003E"}
column1050: description:"\u003C0\u003EEnthusiastic and passionate about human relations Roxana is fully dedicated to building and managing development strategies: a perfect match for the \"happy at work\" figshare atmosphere.\u003C\u002F0\u003E"}
column1052: description:"\u003C0\u003EAfter completing her PhD in Molecular Oncology she is now Project and Operations Manager at Figshare. Away from work
column1055: cooking and having intense discussions with anyone who is willing. Favourite holidays are Halloween and Pancake day!\u003C\u002F0\u003E"}
column1057: description:"\u003C0\u003EWith a degree in Economics and Business Information Systems
column1058: Bogdan started as a tester before moving into project management which he now leads for figshare. He tries to joke most of the time
column1059: with varying success ;) When outside work
column1062: watching soccer and playing with his kids.\u003C\u002F0\u003E"}
column1064: description:"\u003C0\u003ELikes reading about space and fantasy.\u003C\u002F0\u003E"}
column1066: description:"\u003C0\u003EAfter 5 years in the world of gold open access publishing
column1067: Claire joins the team in championing the use of Figshare to support the delivery of open research at institutions in Europe. Having loved living in Lausanne for a couple of years
column1068: the lure of the London foodie scene was enough to draw her back. Will often be found trying out new cuisines and heading to the theatre in her spare time.\u003C\u002F0\u003E"}
column1070: description:"\u003C0\u003ECiprian brings a degree in Automatic Control and Computer Engineering and a Masters to his role in QA team. Hobbies include playing football
column1073: description:"\u003C0\u003EDan began his career in academic publishing and his interest (read: passion) in open science and technology catapulted him into the exciting world of research software. When he’s not busy repping as Team figshare North America

column1079: brain and spirit of figshare for our Government and Funder partners
column1080: taking the lead on everything from data curation
column1082: policies and engagement. A PhD in cognitive psychology before joining the world of academic libraries at Carnegie Mellon
column1083: an advocate always for open data and open science. Cooking
column1085: yoga and elaborate cakes bring joy to her spare time.\u003C\u002F0\u003E"}
column1087: description:"\u003C0\u003EBeing an extremely organised and result oriented person
column1088: Marius naturally enjoys testing and is ISTQB - BCS Tester Foundation Level Certified. In his spare time he studies for his PhD and being directly involved in the world of research
column1089: he definitely understands the importance of the platform that figshare develops. His hobbies are music
column1092: jobsTitle:"grow a good project on a \u003C1\u003Egood mission\u003C\u002F1\u003E"
column1094: jobsTooltip:"we are actively looking for talented individuals interested to get involved in our quest to help science"
column1095: jobs:{"backend":{"description":"\u003Cp\u003EWe're looking for a backend software engineer to join our team.\n                  If you have experience with web development and complex systems
column1096: \n                  if you're concerned about performance and optimizations
column1097: if you're\n                  passionate about clean code
column1100: if you're interested in new technologies than we would\n                  love to meet you.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003Cp\u003EAt figshare
column1101: you'll join forces with a team of smart and very\n                  skilled people on a mission to help the scientific community.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003C2\u003EIf you feel that you are a good fit
